intro: Barleria flava, commonly known as the yellow barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Barleria flava is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
